result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles K. Jilek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--not possess any dangerous weapon, except as neccessary for work purposes and at work only.

The Court also creates an exception to the dangerous weapon for items that could be considered a dangerous weapon that are necessary for household tasks/ duties and home maintenance, these items can remain in the home and Mr. Jilek may use them for their intended purposes. The Court further indicates that any actual dangerous weapon; firearms, etc. shall be de-possessed by Mr. Jilek.

--no contact with Tabitha Jilek, except as permitted by DOC and agreed to by Ms. Jilek

--not engage in any acts or threats of violence toward any person

--complete Certified Batterers' Intervention Counseling

--any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--comply with all family court visitation orders and placement exchange orders regarding his minor children

The Court finds that Mr. Jilek has already provided a DNA sample, does NOT order another 

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles K. Jilek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court's response  to Attorney Mandell's 8-1-16 letter - Huber, and how it is administered - once granted by the Court - is within the province of the sheriff. No further action
from Attorney Mandell requesting conditions of huber be modified

Cases 15CF376 and 16CM176 called together at 11:02 am [mo]
Defendant Charles K. Jilek in court with Attorney David L Mandell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #3 and #4 of Case 15CF376 and Counts #1, #3, #5, #6 of Case 16CM176; 
Factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 and #2 of Case 15CF376 and Counts #2, #4, and #7 of Case 16CM176

Copies of a third party letter provided to Counsel

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel.
The Court adopts the period of time and conditions of Probation as layed out in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which is:
On Counts #3 and #4 of Case 15CF376 and Counts #1, #3, #5, #6 of Case 16CM176, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--complete Certified Batterers' Intervention Counseling
--no contact with Tabitha Jilek, except as permitted by DOC and agreed to by Ms. Jilek
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--not engage in any acts or threats of violence toward any person
--not possess any dangerous weapon, except as neccessary for work purposes and at work only.
--comply with all family court visitation orders and placement exchange orders regarding his minor children
--to pay statutory costs]

The Court orders as part of probation conditional jail:
--On Count #5 of Case #16CM176: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  8/10/16 at 5:30 pm.
--On Count #4 of Case #15CF376: to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  8/10/16 at 5:30 pm

The Court also creates an exception to the dangerous weapon for items that could be considered a dangerous weapon that are necessary for household tasks/ duties and home maintenance, these items can remain in the home and Mr. Jilek may use them for their intended purposes. The Court further indicates that any actual dangerous weapon; firearms, etc. shall be de-possessed by Mr. Jilek. 

The Court finds that Mr. Jilek has already provided a DNA sample, does NOT order another 
Days credit for time already served:  3 days, to be applied to each case
recess:12:10pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Cases 15CF376 and 16CM176 called together at 9:31am [mo]
Defendant Charles K. Jilek in court with Attorney David L Mandell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CM176:
Atty. Mandell admits service of the Criminal Complaint
Atty. Mandell notes his special appearance on this case and stands mute
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the Defendant  


Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
No demand for speedy trial 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of both cases

The Court requires $2000  signature bond, with conditions: 
No direct or indirect contact with: Tabith Jilek; except as necessary for court purposes
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--no acts or threats of violence
--no discusssion of the case with the juveniles with the initials: L.J. and J.J.
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess
: 9:45am


NEXT:  Plea and Sentencing on 6/20/16 at 11:00am

--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--the Defense stands mute, the Court enters pleas of "not guilty" on behalf on the Defendant

Case called at 1:55 pm [sf]
Defendant Charles K. Jilek in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney David L Mandell. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

recess: 2:03 pm to allow the Court to call another matter.
reconvene: 2:59 pm
Court finds the video to be sight and sound sufficient.
ADA Beck now appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Absolute sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with Tabitha Jilek
-Not to discuss the case with J.A.J or L.J. and he may only have contact with the children as decided by the family court consistent with the family court's requirement
-No presence at residence of Ms. Jilek, except on one occasion with law enforcement by 4:30 pm on Nov. 11

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 3:10 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 12/2/15 at 9:00 am
Status: 1/26/16 at 9:00 am
